reviewText: Very nice movie for family night. Don't forget the popcorn and fruit drink.

Quite nice. I was particularly impressed by the character of the "evil" magician, who finally had a change in heart. In a world marred by corruption and violence, we are so used to labeling good vs. evil as two rigid ends of a continuum as opposed to even the possibility of change, and a "second chance" in life. My nine-year old was convinced till the end of the movie that the magician was wicked and he was using the "change of heart" as an alibi to do more harm. The movie hopefully instilled some much-needed element of "trust" in him towards people. He was happy at the end of the movie and "content", which I believe speaks a lot about what the movie wanted to portray - a "feel good" approach towards life.
Kind of a cute story for kids. Acting was almost embarrassingly bad at times although Cheech wasn't bad. The bear was awesome. Worth watching for kids.
This seems to be a good movie for young children. Perhaps they won't notice the poor acting.
The Reason why this movie got four-star is because I'm in it. I was an extra on the set while filming this movie when I was in the third grade. It was good fun and I made a little money.
Actually my 9 year old grandaughter streamed it and loved it. She was glued to the movie and raved about it during and afterwards.
It was a cute movie and my 2 Yr old grandson even liked it.
It was ok low budget film
Horrible acting, plot, etc. Scared my 4 & 5 year old.
A very cute kids story teaching valuable lessons about truth and honesty.
It was a cute movie. Good family entertainment!
